The game I am looking for is a couple of years old, but has 3D graphics. It is a car game where you can perform stunts and explore maps or battle AI cars with weapons. It is not racetrack or race based. It also has a car component damage system, including wheels, engine and other things.

I played it at a friends house and loved it, but I cannot find it or remebers its name anymore.

> 
> Sounds a lot like Carmageddon or Carmageddon 2000. It was racing based, but frankly, who cared about the racing. We all destroyed stuff and ran over people (or zombies if you had the censorship on).
Just Cause 2?

Sounds like you may of played Carmageddon.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmageddon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmageddon)

It has been updated for modern systems as Carmageddon Reincarnation.

[http://www.carmageddon.com/](http://www.carmageddon.com/)

I loved the original, when funds allow, I will likely get the modern version.

[Edit] Ninja'd by Deutherius!

[Edit2] Hmmm, new version isn't getting very good reviews on Steam, seems mostly complaints on frame rate and optimizations. Might wait to see if they improve it. Last time I checked it had not been released yet, so there were no reviews.

[http://store.steampowered.com/app/249380/](http://store.steampowered.com/app/249380/)

[Edit3] Available on GOG (along with Carmageddon II) for $9.99 and $19.98 for Carpocolypse Now:

[http://www.gog.com/game/carmageddon_max_pack](http://www.gog.com/game/carmageddon_max_pack)

[Interstate '76](https://www.google.ca/search?q=Interstate+76&rls=com.microsoft:en-CA:IE-Address&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&sourceid=ie7&gfe_rd=cr&ei=gkhqVfnUNOmM8QeB4oCIDQ&gws_rd=cr) has some of those features, it is quite old however.

interstate '76

<3

carmageddon as well.

sometimes i wish they would breed and have an abominable mutant offspring. it would mix the car dogfighting with the pedestrian splatter demolition derby of carmageddon.

i didnt really like games like twisted metal, it felt too arcadey. carmageddon had a somewhat interesting physics model with deformable geometry on the cars. it wasnt just the carnage in that game that made it awesome. 

interstate '76 ran on the mechwarrior 2 engine which likely explains why i enjoyed the game so much. dogfighting in cars is kind of tricky, the guns were fixed and so if you needed to shoot down a helicopter, you had to find a hill. you could get turreted weapons and missiles but that wasnt as fun. you also had a pistol for shooting out through the side windows. i always wished i could do that in carmageddon, because sheep.
